Uses of Interface
com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison

Packages that use DatabaseLiaison
com.samskivert.jdbc Provides support services to applications that access relational databases via JDBC. 
 

Uses of DatabaseLiaison in com.samskivert.jdbc
 

Classes in com.samskivert.jdbc that implement DatabaseLiaison
 class BaseLiaison
          A superclass to help with the shrinking subset of SQL our supported dialects can agree on, or when there is disagreement, implement the most standard-compliant version and let the dialectal sub-classes override.
 class DefaultLiaison
          The default liaison is used if no other liaison could be matched for a particular database connection.
 class HsqldbLiaison
          Handles liaison for HSQLDB.
 class MySQLLiaison
          A database liaison for the MySQL database.
 class PostgreSQLLiaison
          A database liaison for the MySQL database.
 

Methods in com.samskivert.jdbc that return DatabaseLiaison
static DatabaseLiaison LiaisonRegistry.getLiaison(Connection conn)
          Fetch the appropriate database liaison for the supplied database connection.
static DatabaseLiaison LiaisonRegistry.getLiaison(String url)
          Fetch the appropriate database liaison for the supplied URL, which should be the same string that would be used to configure a connection to the database.
 

Methods in com.samskivert.jdbc with parameters of type DatabaseLiaison
abstract  V AutoCloseOperation.cleanInvoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liason)
          See Repository.Operation.invoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison).
 V Repository.Operation.invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
          Invokes code that performs one or more database operations, all of which will be encapsulated in a single transaction (which can be retried in the event of a transient failure).
 V AutoCloseOperation.invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
          Invokes AutoCloseOperation.cleanInvoke(java.sql.Connection, com.samskivert.jdbc.DatabaseLiaison) and then closes any statements opened by that call.
